intro: Matsumurella chinensis var. robusta, commonly known as the robust Chinese matsumurella, is a species of flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellowish to brownish composite flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or as a landscape plant. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in horticultural settings.
